name: Anthurium 'Dark Mama' (Indo Form)
description: Anthurium 'Dark Mama' (Indo Form) is a hybrid Anthurium created by crossing a dark and narrow form of Anthurium warocqueanum with Anthurium papillilaminum. It is an epiphytic plant native to tropical regions, with this particular form originating from Indonesia. It belongs to the Araceae family and features upright stems (30-60 cm tall) with large, dramatic, heart-shaped to arrow-shaped, velvety, very dark green to almost black leaves with distinctive venation. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit, exhibiting the elongated leaf shape of A. warocqueanum and the vein pattern of A. papillilaminum. Many species have velvety leaves with prominent white or silver veins that create stunning contrast, and some produce fragrant blooms. In tropical forests, this plant typically grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive dark, velvety foliage. It's extremely popular among Anthurium enthusiasts for its unique dark coloration.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but well-draining
Toxic if ingested - keep away from pets and children
Bright indirect light for best flowering
